events.title: Execution of William Wallace
events.description: Scottish knight William Wallace was executed in London after being captured by the English. Wallace was a central figure in the First War of Scottish Independence.
events.significance: Wallace became a symbol of Scottish resistance and nationalism, inspiring future generations and contributing to Scotland's fight for independence.

events.title: Missouri becomes the 24th U.S. state
events.description: Missouri was admitted to the United States as the 24th state as part of the Missouri Compromise, which allowed Missouri to enter as a slave state and Maine as a free state to maintain the balance.
events.significance: The Missouri Compromise was a critical early event in the sectional tensions leading up to the American Civil War.

events.title: Marilyn Monroe performs 'Happy Birthday' to President John F. Kennedy
events.description: Marilyn Monroe famously sang 'Happy Birthday, Mr. President' to John F. Kennedy at Madison Square Garden during his birthday celebration.
events.significance: The performance is remembered as an iconic moment blending pop culture and politics during a charged era in American history.

events.title: United States and Soviet Union sign the SALT I treaty
events.description: The U.S. and USSR signed the Strategic Arms Limitation Talks (SALT I) agreement to limit nuclear weapons, marking a key moment during the Cold War d√©tente.
events.significance: SALT I represented a significant step towards arms control and reducing the risk of nuclear conflict between superpowers.

events.title: Slovenia and Croatia declare independence from Yugoslavia
events.description: Both republics declared independence, triggering the breakup of Yugoslavia and leading to the Yugoslav Wars.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of the end of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia and a major shift in the political landscape of the Balkans.
